intro: Quercus infectoria var. pfaeffingeri, commonly known as the African bracken fern or African oak, is a variant of the common tara tree. It is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa, characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spore-bearing cones, typical of the Fagaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
